line_1: And while the lambs in fainter voices bleat,
line_2: The patient cow doth, to eschew the heat,

line_1: And while the lambs in fainter voices bleat,
line_2: Their mothers hang their head, in doleful plight I weet.

line_1: The nibbling flocks around me bleat,
line_2: The oxen low beneath my feet

line_1: And to their patient dams the frisking lambkins bleat.
line_2: Their ledden loud fat oxen did repeat,

line_1: And to their patient dams the frisking lambkins bleat.
line_2: The woodbine shed an odor matchless sweet,

line_1: My tender Lambs, tho' hungry, ceas'd to bleat:
line_2: My list'ning Ewes, a-while, forsook their Meat;

line_1: And mixt with bellowing Herds confus'dly bleat;
line_2: To the thick Woods the woolly Flocks retreat,

line_1: May the herds cease to lowe, and the lambkins to bleat,
line_2: All be silent, and husht, unless Echo repeat
